Hello people.

I live in the UK and a workmate recently went to Florida on a holiday, I asked them to bring me a model shuttle back if they go to the Space center. I expected a 3-4" die-cast model, Instead i got a 12" set.

Now, my question is, do you think I should keep this intact and un-opened?

My thought process, is that now the shuttle has been cancelled, Memorabilia of it will start becoming more rare. And given its iconic status, i think in 40 years, this Un-Opened toy could be worth a lot of money if its still in mint condition.

What do you think?
Open it. Play with it until it's broken. Too awsome for not-being opened!
Mint condition is for people who own toys as investments and not toys. Open it.
Open it carefully, play around with it, pose it on your bureau. Then walk by it every day for 39 years.

90%+ of things people think will become valuable in decades don't, the rest become valuable because they failed initially and hardly any are left by the time people start getting interested in collecting them.

That thing, probably hundreds of thousands exist, thousands are sitting in basements and lofts waiting for them to become valuable.
Open it, it would be an insult to not play with your gift. If your still unsure, package it up, ship it off to me in Omaha Nebraska USA, and I will play with it for you.
It's unlikely to be worth much unless it's in mint condition, and well, you can see it isn't.
It doesnt seem to be in mint condition anyways; have some fun with it!
It has a free rocket poster! Who cares for the shuttle! All you need is the FREE rocket poster! Lol, but really, you should open it. What everyone else said...

I would say use it how it's intended otherwise the toy's only purpose in this world has been un-fulfilled.

Imagine if you had one purpose in this world and you couldn't do it because you were in a plastic box?

Ok, Ill open it. I know the box is slightly damaged but the product is fine, however, it was in a suitcase for the best part of 20 hours.

As for Playing with it, im 34. I think my Fiance will give me strange looks if I start running round my house with a model shuttle in my hand making rocket noises such as brrrrghhh "ckkkhhhkjkoooooooooowoooooohhhhhh"

Get some black fabric or greenscreen for a backdrop, do some practical effects and film it. Release it as stock footage or make something else out of it.

I mean I'd think that would be fun anyway...
